channel.title: Apparently
channel.description: Most websites worth going to are blocked at my school... Except this one.... So my question is, how to get around it? They use that iBoss web filter. I've tried using the direct ip address, the https thing, none of that works. Anything with the word proxy in it is blocked too. Thx bros.

item.title: Apparently
item.dc:creator: @Graham Graham
item.description:
@Graham wrote:

[quote=“m.dog311, post:23, topic:385323”][quote author=Graham link=topic=481076.msg3523633#msg3523633 date=1299617500]

Use a VPN.

Yep that’s the real kind of solution to go for. Using one of these web proxies is always dodgy and generally I found that sites like Facebook, Twitter, etc that are JavaScript-heavy just don’t work well.

I use the HTTP CONNECT method to connect to my SSH server at school through their proxy (CONNECT was originally intended for accessing HTTPS through a proxy but really you can use it to send any traffic - however generally they’ll restrict it to port 443, so I have to run SSH on port 443 instead of the default). Then I just tunnel everything through SSH. So I get two bonuses: my traffic is encrypted so the staff cannot spy on me and I obviously can access websites (like this one) that would be blocked.
[/quote]
Yea, apparently mscp isn’t blocked, however mitb is.[/quote]

Here both are blocked.

Read full topic

item.title: Apparently
item.dc:creator: @Mack_n_cheese Mack n cheese
item.description:
@Mack_n_cheese wrote:

[quote=“m.dog311, post:20, topic:385323”][quote author=Newty link=topic=481076.msg3522747#msg3522747 date=1299534486]
Oh I forgot, have you tried http://www.ultrareach.com/

Download it to a flash drive and take it to class with you. That got me past EVERY filter at school. Enjoy.
[/quote]
Worked perfectly, thx bro. All my friends got jealous/pissed off when I was on facebook today in study hall ^.^[/quote]quit lying.
you have no friends

Read full topic

item.title: Apparently
item.dc:creator: @m.dog311 m.dog311
item.description:
@m.dog311 wrote:

[quote=“Graham, post:21, topic:385323”][quote author=blakeman8192 link=topic=481076.msg3522647#msg3522647 date=1299521781]
Use a VPN.
[/quote]

Yep that’s the real kind of solution to go for. Using one of these web proxies is always dodgy and generally I found that sites like Facebook, Twitter, etc that are JavaScript-heavy just don’t work well.

I use the HTTP CONNECT method to connect to my SSH server at school through their proxy (CONNECT was originally intended for accessing HTTPS through a proxy but really you can use it to send any traffic - however generally they’ll restrict it to port 443, so I have to run SSH on port 443 instead of the default). Then I just tunnel everything through SSH. So I get two bonuses: my traffic is encrypted so the staff cannot spy on me and I obviously can access websites (like this one) that would be blocked.[/quote]
Yea, apparently mscp isn’t blocked, however mitb is.

Read full topic

[quote=“n10si t, post:13, topic:385323”]What works at our school is typing a link like this:

item.title: Apparently
item.dc:creator: @Graham Graham
item.description:
@Graham wrote:

blakeman8192:

Use a VPN.

Yep that’s the real kind of solution to go for. Using one of these web proxies is always dodgy and generally I found that sites like Facebook, Twitter, etc that are JavaScript-heavy just don’t work well.

I use the HTTP CONNECT method to connect to my SSH server at school through their proxy (CONNECT was originally intended for accessing HTTPS through a proxy but really you can use it to send any traffic - however generally they’ll restrict it to port 443, so I have to run SSH on port 443 instead of the default). Then I just tunnel everything through SSH. So I get two bonuses: my traffic is encrypted so the staff cannot spy on me and I obviously can access websites (like this one) that would be blocked.

Read full topic

[quote=“n10si t, post:13, topic:385323”]What works at our school is typing a link like this:

https://www.google.com[/quote]
We can do that as well, but it doesn’t work on all the websites. Though we’re not allowed to ping or at least don’t have the permissions to be able to ping a website or something, therefore that is off the list for me.

I will attempt the link that Newty posted.

My school is so stupid they block NationalGeographic.com and say it’s a porno website :S
Almost everything is blocked for stupid reasons.

Read full topic

item.title: Apparently
item.dc:creator: @Tom Tom
item.description:
@Tom wrote:

Already happened at my school, everything is blocked. They block sites which contain humor, or anything to do with entertainment of music. Only sites which are related to education remain unblocked.

Isn’t there proxies to like mathslol? I’m sure that was the name of a proxy site everyone used to use at my school, it seemed to bypass the very strict filter. If Newtys method doesn’t work out for you I’ll ask my friends which ones get past the school filter.

Read full topic

item.title: Apparently

item.description:
@m.dog311 wrote:

Alright cool, ill try that when I get home.

Read full topic

item.title: Apparently
item.dc:creator: @NewbieNewty Newty
item.description:
@NewbieNewty wrote:

When I was in highschool I set up my own proxy from my home webserver. I made sure to keep all blocked keywords out of it, eg: proxy, filter, hide, etc.

Mask your webpage with school related things and just stick the proxy in there and I doubt it will be blocked.

Read full topic
